Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel, Great location, Disinterested staff”
Reviews.Author: Scottstache
Reviews.Content: Great renovations with nice style. Really liked the decor. It was really nice having breakfast provided, but the staff's personality was severely lacking. They weren't rude, but always quite aloof and disinterested when interacting with them. The males almost acted as if you were bothering them. One night, I waited 15 minutes for a male staffer to get off the phone, as I needed assistance. I came and stood by him several times and mouthed that I needed help and he just ignored me and laughed and chatted. The only exception was Ana, who pointed out maps and offered her assistance with any needs. She was the only one to do so. It's really too bad they don't have better staff (The women were fine. The men....meh.) because it's a cute hotel on a quiet side street. I'd give pluses across the board if the staff was nicer or at least a little helpful. The hotel is just off a main street in a great location for 10 minute walks to a LOT of the main sites. It also is 5 minutes walk fro two Piazzas which are filled with restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: ballyp
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my mother and we found the hotel to be a great find. It is in an ideal location, with in walking distance to many tourist attractions. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. Our room although small was very well appointed and the bathroom was lovely. Everything was clean and efficient. Breakfast was a feast, with an excellent choice and ample supply to fuel us up for the day ahead. We loved the choice of restaurants and bars, some on the same street, others just minutes away. This really is an excellent value hotel and will definately stay here again on a return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Ticly
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Satyed here 3 nights with a firend. Walking distance to Campo di Fiori and Piazza Navona and many restaurants.Saturday night the street is very noisy, but on the other days, very quiet. The rooms are modern. On the first day on this hotel my towel was dirty and with a hair. The breakfast was good. The staff on the frontdesk was very impatient as giving information.

Reviews.Title: “Great Neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: nleeland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for a trip for our anniversary and were very pleased. This hotel is in a great location and we were very pleased with the amenities of the hotel. The size of the room was one of the largest I have had in Europe. The breakfast had plenty to choose from as well. We had a great time in Rome and this was a great choice for hotels. You could walk to everything, but you are tucked away in a more private street. The only thing that they could improved on would be consistent hot water for the shower. But, overall the stay here was great, and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Sunflowergirl01
Reviews.Content: Great location - manages to be both central and yet relatively untouristy. Loved the neighbourhood - there are some very good restaurants a few minutes walk from the hotel and all of the main sights are easily reached on foot. Hotel has one or two minor teething problems to sort out (its quite new) but the breakfast was good, the rooms cool and quiet and they were able to accommodate our family of 4 in one room with plenty of space (hard to find in Rome!). Hotel will recommend several restaurants - they were all very good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern boutique hotel in a great neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: kw947
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights with my husband. The room was a very ample size, and the bathroom was a good size for Italy. They are a rather new hotel and are still working on issues like consistent hot water and the drain in the shower flowing fast enough, but over-all we had a very good experience here. The room was very clean when we arrived, and they straightened the room every day, but they didn't clean or change the sheets everyday. I wouldn't have expected it every day, but at least once during a four night stay would have been nice. That said, we really enjoyed our stay and would stay there again. The breakfast was excellent -- by far the best meal of the day except one night. The location is perfect. Campo de' Fiori is a charming neighborhood the we fell in love with. Interesting shops, fun bars and cafes, and friendly locals. The hotel is a four minute walk to Piazza Navona, twenty minute walk to the Colosseum, and maybe 30 minutes to the Spanish Steps. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Andre A
Reviews.Content: Well located, very nice hotel, good price! Walking distance to most seighseeings and restaurants...

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome, we'll always stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Hiram D
Reviews.Content: If you like small hotels, in an excellent location, then the Hotel Rinascimento is the place for you! It is located in a refurbished villa in the heart of Rome, close to the Campo de' Fiori and the Tiber River, and within easy walking distance of public transportation. We, however, walked everywhere! Our daughter, who uses a wheelchair or walker, found the hotel very accessible, with no steps into the lobby, an elevator to all the floors, and modern, roll-in bathroom. Our rooms were small, but very comfortable and attractive. The breakfast was delicious, with a choice of hot and/or cold dishes. We spent three nights and plan to stay there next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: knoll
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel primarily for its location and comparatively low cost for Rome. It's located within walking distance to many restaurants, Piazza Navona, Campo dei Fiori and all of the major sights (the Vatican being the farthest, but still walkable) and is a clean, new space. We stayed for 3 nights. The room was very small, modern and nice, but on the second day, we noticed that many ants had come in from the balcony into the room. We informed the front desk and were quickly switched to a much bigger, ant-free room on the 2nd floor at no extra cost. It wasn't an issue of the room being unclean, just a problem with the balcony door in that particular room. Other than that, our stay was great. Located on a quiet side street, great air conditioning and breakfast was OK as well.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT and WE WILL BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: candygirl82
Reviews.Content: The best hotel ever!!!!!. I went to this hotel with my fiancee and we had an amazing time. Rome was a place that I always wanted to go to and I must say that both Rome and the hotel far exceeded my expectation. The receptionist was welcoming and informed us of where to go while in Rome, also providing us with a map with all the landmarks. They were always smiling and were always there to answer our questions. The complimentary breakfast was DELICIOUS. There was eggs, cereal, different kinds of pastries, yogurts, coffee, tea, juice, etc. There was everything you needed to eat a hearty breakfast, you had many different choices for breakfast and everything was fresh and delicious. The location of the hotel was PERFECT, it was walking distance to all the famous landmarks, so I was really happy because I could always come back to the hotel in the afternoon to freshen up, rest and go back out again. The hotel room was VERY spacious, clean and updated, the bathroom was amazing, the shower INCREDIBLE. Overall this hotel was just magnificent and when we go back to Rome, I will definitely book this hotel again, that is for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy with Hotel RInascimento- beautiful hotel, great location, nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: HokieGirl22
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 4 nights at Hotel Rinascimento while traveling in Rome with a friend. The hotel looked just like the pictures online. It was very modern and clean. The bathroom had a rain shower head, and was a decent size. The staff spoke fluent English and were very helpful. The breakfast was substantial although we usually slept in and skipped it. The location was very central, we walked everywhere from Ancient Rome, Vatican City, Pantheon, North Rome, Trastavere, etc. Nothing was more than 1 mile or so. They have a computer and nice lounge by the check-in desk. Also, the street was relatively quiet with the window closed. We stayed in 2 different rooms and both had a window that opened onto the small street out front. Our second room had 2 double doors that opened to the outside with a beautiful view of a church down the street. We switched rooms because they did not have 2 twin beds available the first night, but the double bed was large enough for us to sleep comfortably. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here if I go back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Only if you are 150% certain that you can make it!”
Reviews.Author: IslandManRides
Reviews.Content: We were so looking forward to our stay in Rome and at the Hotel Rinascimento. However, due to a broken USAir aircraft, we were unable to make it. I contacted the hotel as soon as humanly possible (twice before the plane was canceled and twice after it was canceled), but they still refused to return all or part of our prepaid lodging. So, my review is not of the quality of the hotel or its location, but rather on their business practices. It is typical in the travel and lodging industry to recognize circumstances beyond the travellers control and to refund the money. In this case, this hotel is representative of what we hear of hotels in Rome, don't trust them to do the right thing. If you are not in complete control of your travel modes, then don't book here. I even told them that I picked them based on their reviews on this website and that I always provide a review. It didn’t help!!! Beware, they will screw you! Pick a larger chain hotel while in Rome that MAY work with you if your flight is canceled.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very nice and quite hotel”
Reviews.Author: jhanlon31
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, that is a typical small non-chain hotel in Europe. It is very updated and modern in the decoration and utilities. The staff is very attentive and helpful and it has a very personal feel to it. The location is great and is walking distance to most of the big sights in Rome. Thought it is tucked away in off of a small street so not the easiest to find at first.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: tonderk
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, very good service,superclean rooms, very well located in the center of the city,(Campo de' Fiori 2 mınutes, Pıazza Navona 5 mınutes, Vatican 8-10 mınutes) superb breakfast, very friendly reception, good concsierge. Two thumbs up !!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location clean small hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenissASt_Petersburg
Reviews.Content: Probably a bit overpriced but very well located, very clean and with polite stuff.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Rinascimento
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Pellegrino 122, 00186 Rome, Italy
